intro: Turnera lineata, commonly known as the silverleaf turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
